info.title: Customer Service Agent API
info.description:
## AI-Powered Customer Service REST API

This API provides an intelligent customer service agent with:

### ðŸ¤– Core Features
- **Conversational AI**: Natural language understanding powered by Azure OpenAI
- **Multi-Turn Conversations**: Session-based dialogue management
- **Order Management**: Query, track, and modify customer orders
- **Email Communication**: Automated customer notifications
- **Complaint Tracking**: MCP integration for complaint management

### ðŸ”§ Technical Capabilities
- **Multi-Tenant**: Tenant isolation for session management
- **Rate Limiting**: Configurable per-IP request throttling
- **Request Tracing**: UUID-based request correlation
- **Health Monitoring**: Liveness and readiness probes

### ðŸ“š Documentation
- **Interactive Docs**: Available at `/docs` (Swagger UI)
- **Alternative Docs**: Available at `/redoc` (ReDoc)
- **OpenAPI Spec**: Available at `/openapi.json`

### ðŸš€ Quick Start
1. Check service health at `/health`
2. Create a session at `/api/v1/agent/sessions`
3. Send messages at `/api/v1/agent/messages`
4. View session history at `/api/v1/sessions/{id}/history`

get.description: Get overall health status of the service and its components
Check if the service is ready to accept requests
Simple liveness probe for Kubernetes/container orchestration

schema.title: Response Liveness Check Health Live Get

post.description: Create a new conversation session with the agent
Send a message to the agent in a session

get.description: Get information about available agent tools

Get conversation history for a session.

**Parameters:**
- `session_id`: Session identifier
- `tenant_id`: Tenant identifier (default: "default")

**Returns:**
- Session history including all messages

**Errors:**
- `404`: Session not found
- `410`: Session expired

delete.description:
Delete a session.

**Parameters:**
- `session_id`: Session identifier
- `tenant_id`: Tenant identifier (default: "default")

**Returns:**
- Confirmation message

**Errors:**
- `404`: Session not found

get.description:
List all sessions for a tenant.

**Parameters:**
- `tenant_id`: Tenant identifier (default: "default")
- `limit`: Maximum number of sessions (1-100, default: 50)
- `offset`: Number of sessions to skip (default: 0)

**Returns:**
- List of session summaries

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of sessions to return
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of sessions to return

post.description:
Manually trigger session cleanup (removes expired sessions).

This is typically called automatically by a background task,
but can be triggered manually via this endpoint.

**Returns:**
- Number of sessions deleted

get.description:
Get session statistics.

**Returns:**
- Session statistics including total count
Get basic API information including version and documentation links

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Optional custom session ID (auto-generated if not provided)

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Optional metadata to attach to the session

CreateSessionRequest.title: CreateSessionRequest
CreateSessionRequest.description: Request model for creating a new conversation session.

status.title: Status
status.description: Overall health status: healthy, degraded, unhealthy

ListToolsResponse.title: ListToolsResponse
ListToolsResponse.description: Response model for listing available tools.

ready.title: Ready
ready.description: Whether the service is ready to accept requests

message.title: Message
message.description: User message to send to the agent

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Whether to stream the response (not yet implemented)

SendMessageRequest.title: SendMessageRequest
SendMessageRequest.description: Request model for sending a message to the agent.

SessionHistoryResponse.title: SessionHistoryResponse
SessionHistoryResponse.description: Response model for session history endpoint.

available.title: Available
available.description: Whether the tool is currently available
